section: The Joint Venturers may be required to make capital contributions to the Joint Venture as needed.
explanation: This statement is vague and doesn't specify how the need for capital contributions will be determined, the amount or proportion each venturer will contribute, or what happens if a venturer cannot or will not contribute. This lack of detail creates ambiguity and could lead to disputes.

section: It is agreed that either Joint Venturer shall have authority to execute instruments of any character relating to the affairs of the Joint Venture.
explanation: This statement grants both Joint Venturers the authority to execute instruments of any character relating to the affairs of the Joint Venture, which is not clear if it means that either Joint Venturer can independently make decisions and execute documents without the other's consent. This could potentially lead to conflicting actions or obligations undertaken by each venturer, creating confusion about which actions are valid or binding on the Joint Venture. It also does not set a limit on the type of instruments that can be executed.

section: All income and credits, and all losses and deductions shall be owned and shared among the Joint Venturers as follows: 50% to Collectible Concepts Group, Inc. 50% to Pivotal Self Service Tech, Inc.
explanation: While the percentages are clear, the agreement lacks details on how these income, credits, losses, and deductions will be calculated and reported for tax purposes. There is no mention of specific accounting methods for tracking and allocating these items, which could lead to discrepancies in financial reporting and tax liabilities.
